Creating a Simple Query

In StarTeam, you can write simple queries or complicated queries that use several conditions and one or more logical operators. The simplest query has only one condition. For example, the following query locates change requests for which a single person is responsible.

To create a simple query:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Click a component tab.

  3. Do one of the following:

    • Right-click a column header on upper pane. Then select Queries from the context menu.

    • Select Filters > Queries from the component or context menu.

    The Queries dialog opens.

  4. Click New. The New Query dialog opens.

  5. Enter a name for your query in the Name text box.

  6. Do one of the following:

    • Select the Public check box to add this query to the project (and the server configuration), allowing anyone with the appropriate access rights to use it.

    • Clear the Public check box to make the query private – that is, available only to your user ID.

  7. Create the condition:

    1. Select a field from the Field drop-down list box, which includes the most common fields. To display every possible field in the list box, select the Show advanced fields check box.

    2. Select an operator from the Operator drop-down list.

    3. Enter a value in or select a value from the Value text or list box. This value will be compared with the value of the selected field for each available item.

  8. Click Add to place this condition in the Query tree box. By default, the Query tree box contains the AND operator as the root of the tree. You do not need a logical operator for a simple query, but you cannot delete the root of the tree. If there is only one condition, StarTeam ignores the logical operator.

  9. (Optional) Click View as text to view the query in text format. Notice that the default logical AND operator was not included in your query. Click OK to close the window.

  10. Click Save. The Queries dialog now lists your query.

  11. If this is a public query, you may want to set access rights for it. See Granting Access Rights at the Component Level and Granting Access Rights for Specific Filters and Queries.

  12. Do one of the following:

    • Select the query from the Queries dialog and click Select to apply the query to the items in the upper pane.

    • Click Close to exit without applying your query.

Tip: If you change your mind about adding a condition while creating your query, select the condition, then click Edit to modify it or Delete to eliminate it.
